lg.l: SYth Time permits, refuse not, nor disdayne
to learne a right such things as here be founde:
For why? this Author first herein did take the paine,
hereby to shewe of Grammer rules the ground.
In order good thy workes will then appeare,
and from right rule not seeme to swarue a iote.
If all the actes of these archieued here
accordingly thou well thou do weigh and note.
Come nigh therfore (I say) and take a taste
of pleasant liquours here detected plaine,
If that thou couet speedily in haste,
of Latine stile to choose the fruitefull graine:
For all things fade, as brouches, golde and stone,
when vertue swimmes, and scapes to shore alone.
